com.mashery.http

Class URI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mashery.http.URI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MutableURI

    public class URI
extends Object
    Immutable representation of a hierarchical URI according to RFC-2396. No encoding or decoding of the whole or individual parts is performed, and character validity is not checked. The user of this class is responsible for making sure that the URI is valid for their purposes.

    Conversion to URI is provided through method toURI().

    See Also:
    MutableURI
    Restriction
    This class is not intended to be subclassed by clients.

      • toURI

        public URI toURI()
          throws URISyntaxException
        Creates a java.net.URI instance out of this URI. Individual parts of this URI are first reassembled, then reparsed by java.net.URI in order to avoid double-encoding of some characters.
        Returns:
        java.net.URI representation of this URI
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - if java.net.URI encountered an error while parsing this URI

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • parse

        public static URI parse(String str)
        Creates a URI instance by parsing the given string. No character or other validation is performed; parsing consists of splitting the string using a regular expression.
        Parameters:
        str - URI string to parse
        Returns:
        new URI instance
